publicationStmt.publisher: Uppsala University, Department of linguistics and philology

msIdentifier.repository: Wroblewski Library of the Lithuanian Academy of Sciences in Vilniuse, Lithuania

msContents.summary: Translations of Biblical texts into North-Western Karaim: The Latter Prophets, The Twelve Minor Prophets, the Sifrei Emet (Psalms, Proverbs, Job), and the Five Megillot (Song of Songs, Ruth, Lamentations, Ecclesiastes, Esther)

ab.title: Psalms 129
ab.l: Širasy ol maʿalalarnyn ḱop tarlyḥlar učradylar ḿeni jaš ḱuńĺarimd́ań ajtsyn eńdi Jiśraʾeĺ.
Ḱop tarlyḥlar učradylar ḿeni jašlyḥlarymdan da jeńaĺḿadiĺar ḿeni.
Arqam üśt́uńa saban śur- d́uĺar sabančylar uzarttylar biĺgisiń sabanlarynyn.

H rast Teńri
qypčydy bazyḥ örḱańĺariń rašaʿlarnyn.
Ujatly bolurlar da ked́argi ket́arĺar artḥary bar dušmanlary Cijonnun.
Bolgejlar ḱoǵut́u kibik čardaḥlarnyn ki qamušundan suvururmajynča qurujdyr.
Tolturmas- tyr uvučun oruvču da biĺagiń ḱuĺt́a bajlavču.
Da ajtmaslar ol ašuvčular alɣyšy H-nyn siźǵa alɣyšlejbyz siźni šemi byla H-nyn.

app.note: It might be related to the South-Western Karaim word qypty- ʻрезатьʼ (KRPS 387).
